festival.introText:
Truck is undoubtedly one of those festivals that shows the rest of them how it should be done. Expect to meet lots of great people, listen to a load of cool music, and have a lovely time. Having recently been run by the team behind the Y-Not festival in Derbyshire, the festival has stayed true to it original aesthetic, that is one of a relaxed, chilled out summer celebration, featuring impressive headline acts, combined with a local farmyard feel. 

Previous headliners have included the likes of The Temper Trap, Mystery Jets, Mercury Rev, 65 Days of Static, The Go! Team, Graham Coxon, Ash, Supergrass, and recently Tim Minchin. Attracting a wide range of age groups and people from all walks of life, Truck is a genuine Festival that brings people together, creating an unpretentious, good natured atmosphere that is a joy to be a part of.

faqs.question: When is Truck Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Truck Festival is held on Friday 21st July - Sunday 23rd July 2023.

faqs.question: How to get to Truck Festival by Coach
faqs.answer:
Truck Festival is working in conjunction with National Express to offer dedicated coaches that can take you and your luggage / camping gear straight to the festival site.

 

You can purchase tickets here: https://truckfestival.seetickets.com/event/truck-festival-2023/hill-farm/2377743?pageofferid=55699754#op3

faqs.question: Is there camping available at Truck Festival?
faqs.answer: Yes, there a several camping options available at Truck Festival so you can make the most of your weekend.

faqs.question: Accessibility at Truck Festival
faqs.answer:
Truck Festival is hugely dedicated to making their event as accessible as possible for everyone.

 

They have a PA ticket scheme, accessible viewing areas and dedicated parking and camping areas, accessible facilities and hearing loops. For further info, have a look at the Truck Festival website.

faqs.question: Where is Truck Festival?
faqs.answer: Truck Festival is located at Hill Farm, Oxford.

faqs.question: How to get to Truck Festival by Train
faqs.answer: The nearest railway station to the festival is Didcot Parkway Station. From there you can take a connecting shuttle bus or taxi direct to the festival site. The shuttle bus will be run by Thames Travel and an adult return will cost just £5.

faqs.question: What camping options are available at Truck Festival?
faqs.answer:
There are loads of camping options at Truck Festival including:

  • General camping
  • Family camping
  • Luxury camping
  • Glamping / Boutique camping
  • Pre-pitched 

See the Truck Festival website for more information.

  • Accessible camping
  • Campervan & Caravan

faqs.question: What are the opening times at Truck Festival?
faqs.answer:
Thursday 20th July

Gates for Early Entry Ticket holders open at 1pm. 

Box Office closes at 11pm.

 

Friday 21st July

Gates open at 10am.

Box Office closes at 11pm.

 

Saturday 22nd July - Sunday 23rd July

Gates open at 9am.

Box Office closes at 11pm.

 

Monday 24th July

Campsites have to be clear by midday.

faqs.question: Is there parking available at Truck Festival?
faqs.answer:
Yes, although there is a charge. It is cheaper to book in advance than on the day. The car park you are assigned will depend on the camping area you have booked, so please check Truck Festival's website for further details on this.

 

The address is: Hill Farm, Church Lane, Steventon, Oxon, OX13 6SW.

 

Signs will be around the area directing you to the site.

faqs.question: Does Truck Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer:
There are no age restrictions at Truck Festival, however you may be asked to show valid photo ID (passport, driving/provisional license, citizen card). Photocopies will not be accepted.

 

Weeknd tickets are for those 13 and above. Children aged 12 and under go free but will need an entry ticket added to your booking.

 

Anyone age 16+ is allowed to attend on their own but will be asked for ID on entry.

 

Under 16s must be accompanied by an adult (21+) at all times.

 

All alcohol sales on site will be operating the Challenge 25 policy. If you look under 25, you will need a valid photo ID in order to be served alcohol.

faqs.question: Can I leave Truck Festival and come back?
faqs.answer: Yes, although be aware that you will only be allowed to bring alcohol into the campsites on your first entry. If you are driving each day please keep hold of your parking ticket as proof of purchase.

faqs.question: Can I take alcohol into the arena at Truck Festival?
faqs.answer: No. Only refillable water bottles will be permitted and free water will be available on site and in the campsites.
